chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant David A. Stone III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland , WI  54806
Def placed on a pymt plan of $35/mo beginning 8/3/15
To seek, obtain and maintain full time employment/full time schooling or a combination of the two.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Defendant, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!
DOC has authority to permit def to go on premises that serves alcohol for purposes to seek work/employment.
  The Defendant is subject to random UA testing.
Def to have NO contact w/Tanya Kuzuch & Theodora Fohr or their residence.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

The Defendant is to provide a DNA specimen.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney S. Joseph Randtke appeared by phone means for Defendant David A. Stone. Prosecuting Atty Kelly J Mcknight appeared for State of Wisconsin. 15CF18,15Cf249,15Cf155 and 16CF295. Ct has been advised that Stone will not accept the courts phone call. Ct comments on sentencing issues, Ct not sure where to go, not sure if failure to take phone call is acquiescence, def wanting to appr in person, not sure. Atty Randke has not spoken with Def in person, Def feels that he was given an extra year on his sentence. Atty Randke believes the Ct made a minor error in the letter total sentence at the time was 2 1/2 on one file and 1 yr on the other file CS, other case was supposed to be concurrent. 
DA Def needs to be here or waive his appearance so that is state's position. Ct asks what the agreement of the parties originally. Atty Randke 3 cases believes that JOCs from that date one of the cases was consecutive that should be cc. 
Ct doesnt have new evidence, Ct was going to follow the agreement of the parties, Ct will review the record and make correction, Def needs to then file a motion if he has issue. Atty Randke comments at that time if Def has appellate issue would move to withdraw.
include consecutive language

records.addlTxt:
15CF155 and 15CF249 and 15CF18 Defendant David A. Stone in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Ct received letter from DOC in 15CF249 regarding must run consecutive instead of concurrently which court did.  They also need clarification in 15CF18.  Discussion about 7 days additional credit.   15CF155 - Max term was 2 years - needs to change as well.  DA - agreement to modify? - no talk about it, came to court with agreement of principle for amt of time served.  DA request - court enforce the intent of the parties.  With respect to 15CF155 - court ordered 1 year initial conf and 1 year ext.  If JOC reflects something different then not intent of parties.  Count 3 - no problem.  Count 4 should be amended to 1 year init and 1 year extended and all other aspects of that judgment should remain.  Attorney - states that is accurate.  Stone - no comment.  Concurrent with Count 3. 

COURT ORDERS:  Amend JOC in 15CF155 to change sentence to 1 year in/1 year ext, runs concurrent with Count 3 in  15CF155 and with 16CF295.         

16CF295 - DOC finds no fault .              

15CF18:   Court has reviewed how many actual days it was contemplated def would serve under original sentence - believe court calculated that he would have 48 days left to serve as to the day he was sentenced.  If reach same result - sentence would go down to 74 days and cts go down to 7 days which would require him to serve 49 more days.  DA thinks he agrees with that and if court's calculations reflect that then agree, attorney agree, def agrees.  15CF18 - two issues - (1) sentence should go down to 74 days (2) cts go down to 7 days, stays consecutive to 17CF56 and any other sentences def prev ordered to serve when do amended JOC - NUNC PRO TUNC - effective as of April 12, 2017.    15CF18 - Count 4? Issue with DOC regarding this count.   COURT ORDERS:  15CF18 - JOC AMENDED on Revoked Count 2 - Court costs, financial obligaions remain Count 4 amended to 74 days sentence, 7 days cts good time.  Effective as to April 12, 2017 - nunc pro tunc.             

15CF24:  Attorney wants this as the controlling sentence.  DA disagrees with that.  Attorney continues to comment.  Def comments.

COURT:  In addition to changes already made to 15CF155 - amend the JOC so that each of two counts has initial confinement of 1 year 6 mo and ext supervision of 1 year. Concurrently with 16CF295 but NOT with 15CF249.  

16CF295 - Amend that JOC to 1 year 6 mo initial 1 year extended and run concurrent with 15CF155.

15CF249 - Sentence to WDOC 2 year 1 year in 1 year ext consecutive to Cases 15CF155 and 16CF295

16CF295 - 0 days cts - grant def additional 200 days credit in 15CF155 and 16CF295.    

15CF249 and 15CF155 - Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program on ALL CHARGES.  All other remain in full force and effect.
